com.yworks.yfiles.view.input

Class LabelSnapContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.view.input.SnapContext
      • com.yworks.yfiles.view.input.LabelSnapContext

  • public class LabelSnapContext
extends SnapContext
    Manages interactive snapping of ILabels to their owner during drag operations like movements.

    This class provides a set of properties to customize the snapping behavior. IPositionHandler implementations and similar classes can use the following idiom to get an instance of this class:

    See Also:
    MoveLabelInputMode, GraphEditorInputMode.getSnapContext()

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      LabelSnapContext()
      Initializes a new instance of the LabelSnapContext class.

    • Method Detail

      • addCollectSnapLinesListener

        public final void addCollectSnapLinesListener(IEventHandler<CollectLabelSnapLineEventArgs> collectSnapLinesEvent)
        Adds the given listener for the CollectSnapLines event that occurs every time this instance has been initialized to collect SnapLines.

        Event handlers should add snap lines to the caller using the methods provided by CollectLabelSnapLineEventArgs.

        Parameters:
        collectSnapLinesEvent - The listener to add.
        See Also:
        removeCollectSnapLinesListener(IEventHandler)

      • addSnapLine

        public final void addSnapLine(SnapLine snapLine)
        Adds the given snapLine to the snap line collection of this context.
        Parameters:
        snapLine - The snap line to add.
        See Also:
        GraphSnapContext.getAdditionalSnapLines()

      • cleanUp

        protected void cleanUp()
        Description copied from class: SnapContext
        Performs clean up procedures.

        This is called in response to SnapContext.cancelDrag() and SnapContext.dragFinished(PointD, boolean) as well as initially during SnapContext.initializeDrag(IInputModeContext, PointD).

        Overrides:
        cleanUp in class SnapContext

      • dragFinished

        public SnapState dragFinished(PointD newLocation,
                              boolean snappingDisabled)
        Description copied from class: SnapContext
        Called when a drag has been successfully finished.

        Clears all temporary lists and sets IsInitialized back to false. Also the SnapContext.cleanUp() method is invoked and the CleanedUp event is triggered.

        Overrides:
        dragFinished in class SnapContext
        Parameters:
        newLocation - The current mouse location.
        snappingDisabled - If set to true snapping is temporarily disabled. This will remove the snap line visualizations and return a SnapState with the unchanged coordinates and the SnapTypes.NOT_SNAPPED SnapType.
        Returns:
        A SnapState that specifies the adjusted coordinates and how they have been adjusted. The unchanged coordinates if snapping has been temporarily disabled by setting snappingDisabled to true.

      • dragInitialized

        public void dragInitialized()
        Description copied from class: SnapContext
        Collects a list of snap lines.

        Snap lines represent possible horizontal or vertical lines to which a moved item can "snap".

        This method is called at the start of MoveInputMode's or HandleInputMode's gesture after all items to be moved or reshaped have been added.

        Overrides:
        dragInitialized in class SnapContext

      • getSnapLineExtension

        public final double getSnapLineExtension()
        Gets the amount by which snap lines that are induced by existing edge segments are being extended.

        The default is 40.0d, this value will be used to prolongate the ends of the snap lines.

        Returns:
        The amount by which snap lines that are induced by existing edge segments are being extended.
        See Also:
        setSnapLineExtension(double)

      • getSnapLines

        public final IEnumerable<SnapLine> getSnapLines()
        The collection of the snap lines that have been added to this context.

        This collection is only available if IsInitialized is true.

        Returns:
        The SnapLines.
        See Also:
        addSnapLine(SnapLine)

      • handleMove

        public SnapState handleMove(PointD newLocation,
                            boolean snappingDisabled)
        Description copied from class: SnapContext
        Handles a move.

        This method returns the adjusted (mouse) coordinates. It also manages the collection of SnapResults. If snapping should be temporarily (for a mouse move) disabled, snappingDisabled has to be set to true.

        Overrides:
        handleMove in class SnapContext
        Parameters:
        newLocation - The current mouse location.
        snappingDisabled - If set to true snapping is temporarily disabled. This will remove the snap line visualizations and return a SnapState with the unchanged coordinates and the SnapType SnapTypes.NOT_SNAPPED.
        Returns:
        The adjusted coordinates and how they have been adjusted. The unchanged coordinates if snapping has been temporarily disabled by setting snappingDisabled to true.

      • initializeDrag

        public void initializeDrag(IInputModeContext context,
                           PointD originalLocation)
        Description copied from class: SnapContext
        Called by IInputMode implementations when an interactive drag is started.

        Updates IsInitializing, OriginalLocation, and CurrentInputModeContext and then triggers the Initializing event.

        Overrides:
        initializeDrag in class SnapContext
        Parameters:
        context - The context in which the interactive drag is started.
        originalLocation - The original location of the mouse.

      • isCollectingAllEdgeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled

        public final boolean isCollectingAllEdgeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled()
        Determines whether this instance should collect snap lines in parallel to the edge path of the label owner at the distance of other edge labels in the graph.

        The default is false.

        Returns:
        true if this instance should collect this kind of snap lines; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setCollectingAllEdgeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled(boolean)

      • isCollectingAllNodeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled

        public final boolean isCollectingAllNodeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled()
        Determines whether this instance should collect snap lines in parallel to the border of the label owner at the distance of other node labels in the graph.

        Note that the label snaps to these snap lines with the side that is closer to the node's border. That way, snapping to such a snap line preserves the perceived distance from the node border for both labels inside and outside the node bounds.

        The default is false.

        Returns:
        true if this instance should collect this kind of snap lines; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setCollectingAllNodeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled(boolean)

      • isCollectingEdgePathSnapLinesEnabled

        public final boolean isCollectingEdgePathSnapLinesEnabled()
        Determines whether this instance should collect snap lines on the edge path.

        The default is true.

        Returns:
        true if this instance should collect this kind of snap lines; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setCollectingEdgePathSnapLinesEnabled(boolean)

      • isCollectingInitialLocationSnapLinesEnabled

        public final boolean isCollectingInitialLocationSnapLinesEnabled()
        Determines whether this instance should collect snap lines for the initial position of a label.

        The default is true.

        Returns:
        true if this instance should collect snap lines for the initial position of a label; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setCollectingInitialLocationSnapLinesEnabled(boolean)

      • isCollectingNodeShapeSnapLinesEnabled

        public final boolean isCollectingNodeShapeSnapLinesEnabled()
        Determines whether this instance should collect six snap lines, two through the center and four through the border sides of the label owner.

        The default is true.

        Returns:
        true if this instance should collect snap lines through the border and center of the label owner; otherwise, false.
        See Also:
        setCollectingNodeShapeSnapLinesEnabled(boolean)

      • isCollectingOwnEdgeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled

        public final boolean isCollectingOwnEdgeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled()
        Determines whether this instance should collect two snap lines in parallel to the edge path of the label owner at the initial distance of the edge label.

        The default is true.

        Returns:
        true if this instance should collect this kind of snap lines; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setCollectingOwnEdgeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled(boolean)

      • isCollectingOwnNodeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled

        public final boolean isCollectingOwnNodeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled()
        Determines whether this instance should collect four snap lines in parallel to the owner's borders at the initial label distance.

        Note that the label snaps to these snap lines with the side that is closer to the node's border. That way, snapping to such a snap line preserves the perceived distance from the node border for both labels inside and outside the node bounds.

        The default is true.

        Returns:
        true if this instance should collect snap lines through the border and center of the label owner; otherwise, false.
        See Also:
        setCollectingOwnNodeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled(boolean)

      • isCollectingSameOwnerEdgeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled

        public final boolean isCollectingSameOwnerEdgeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled()
        Determines whether this instance should collect snap lines in parallel to the edge path of the label owner at the distances of all edge labels of that owner.

        The default is true.

        Returns:
        true if this instance should collect this kind of snap lines; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setCollectingSameOwnerEdgeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled(boolean)

      • isCollectingSameOwnerNodeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled

        public final boolean isCollectingSameOwnerNodeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled()
        Determines whether this instance should collect snap lines in parallel to the border of the label owner at the distance of other node labels of that owner.

        Note that the label snaps to these snap lines with the side that is closer to the node's border. That way, snapping to such a snap line preserves the perceived distance from the node border for both labels inside and outside the node bounds.

        The default is true.

        Returns:
        true if this instance should collect this kind of snap lines; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setCollectingSameOwnerNodeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled(boolean)

      • isSnappingEdgeLabelsEnabled

        public final boolean isSnappingEdgeLabelsEnabled()
        Specifies whether this context will automatically snap the edge labels to snap lines.

        The default is true.

        Returns:
        true if edge labels will snap to snap lines; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setSnappingEdgeLabelsEnabled(boolean)

      • isSnappingNodeLabelsEnabled

        public final boolean isSnappingNodeLabelsEnabled()
        Specifies whether this context will automatically snap the node labels to snap lines.

        The default is true.

        Returns:
        true if node labels will snap to snap lines; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setSnappingNodeLabelsEnabled(boolean)

        Parameters:

      • removeCollectSnapLinesListener

        public final void removeCollectSnapLinesListener(IEventHandler<CollectLabelSnapLineEventArgs> collectSnapLinesEvent)
        Removes the given listener for the CollectSnapLines event that occurs every time this instance has been initialized to collect SnapLines.

        Event handlers should add snap lines to the caller using the methods provided by CollectLabelSnapLineEventArgs.

        Parameters:
        collectSnapLinesEvent - The listener to remove.
        See Also:
        addCollectSnapLinesListener(IEventHandler)

        Note that the label snaps to these snap lines with the side that is closer to the node's border. That way, snapping to such a snap line preserves the perceived distance from the node border for both labels inside and outside the node bounds.

        The default is false.

        Parameters:

      • setCollectingOwnNodeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled

        public final void setCollectingOwnNodeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled(boolean value)
        Determines whether this instance should collect four snap lines in parallel to the owner's borders at the initial label distance.

        Note that the label snaps to these snap lines with the side that is closer to the node's border. That way, snapping to such a snap line preserves the perceived distance from the node border for both labels inside and outside the node bounds.

        The default is true.

        Parameters:

        See Also:
        isCollectingOwnNodeDistanceSnapLinesEnabled()

      • setSnapLineExtension

        public final void setSnapLineExtension(double value)
        Sets the amount by which snap lines that are induced by existing edge segments are being extended.

        The default is 40.0d, this value will be used to prolongate the ends of the snap lines.

        Parameters:
        value - The amount by which snap lines that are induced by existing edge segments are being extended.
        See Also:
        getSnapLineExtension()

      • wrapContext

        public IInputModeContext wrapContext(IInputModeContext context)
        Description copied from class: SnapContext
        Helper method that wraps the given context so that a ILookup.lookup(Class) query on the wrapped context for the SnapContext type yields this instance.
        Overrides:
        wrapContext in class SnapContext
        Parameters:
        context - The context to wrap and delegate all calls to.
        Returns:
        A modified instance that yields this instance if it is queried for the SnapContext type.
